alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 6:08PM EDT until July 05 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Laurel and Whitley. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vox, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Grove, Keavy, Hightop, Rye, Baldrock, Bark Camp, Rockcastle Springs, Dorthae, North Corbin and Corbin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
